jobs.description:
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking to hire a highly motivated, best-in-class Cluster Security Manager to manage the physical security at our data centers.

Job responsibilities

You will be responsible for managing a team of Security Managers in charge of on-site operational physical security of our Data Centers.
This includes management of access control systems and process, guard force management, contract management, vendor management, risk assessment & management, reporting security metrics, security audits and incident reporting.

You will also understand and maintain compliance requirements with standards such as SOC1, SOC2 and ISO27001. You will be responsible for the implementation of new processes and adherence to existing Amazon policy and procedure relating to security guarding, media security, CCTV monitoring and the protection of customer data. You will also be required to work closely with other Amazon teams to deliver tight project schedules on time and within budget. You will communicate status updates and ensure adherence to tight schedules and deadlines.

As Cluster Security Manager you will possess proven people management skills and will build relationships with internal and external partners to maintain and enhance the security and safety. You will coordinate physical security (security services, access control and CCTV systems, site surveys), investigations, risk/threat assessments. You and your team will supervise employees and contractors performing specific security and safety objectives and monitor vendor performance and expenses.

Key job responsibilities
• Manage the daily operations of the vendors providing services, training and risk assessment; conduct investigations of Code of Conduct, and other violations, as needed
• Collaborate with other teams within Amazon (Data Center (DC) Engineering, DC Operations, etc.) and outside of Amazon (Vendors, Emergency Services, etc.) as they relate to daily operations
• Develop security plans for on-site special events and other unique security situations to assure proper access control and evacuation procedures are followed
• Perform data analysis and create benchmarking to support risk assessments and threat identification
• Partner with DC Engineering and other Amazon business units to identify safety and security deficiencies, and develop customized policies and procedures to gain compliance with regulations internal and external to Amazon
• As part of a global team in this space you will also be required to work with peers in other geographic regions and travel as required by Amazon

jobs.description:
We are seeking a Manager III - Sales to lead the Consumables Account Management team responsible for driving growth and development of high-impact sellers on the Amazon.in marketplace.

The ideal candidate excels in ambiguous environments, developing and iterating business strategies that deliver sustainable growth and exceptional seller experiences. This leader should be hands-on, detail-oriented, maintain relentlessly high standards, and operate with an owner's mindset—understanding the key levers to achieve results through their team. The candidate demonstrates a passion for people leadership and thrives when building, developing, and guiding high-performing teams.

In this role, you will drive strategic business and operational objectives for your Account Management team. You will lead the creation and execution of strategies to achieve business goals by focusing on selection expansion, leveraging Fulfillment channels for faster delivery, developing merchandising strategies, and improving catalog quality. You will actively collaborate with stakeholders including Category Management, Fulfillment, Finance, Product, and Advertising teams to align programs and initiatives that identify growth opportunities and drive seller success.

This position is based at Amazon India, Bengaluru office.

If you are passionate about growing brands and businesses on Amazon, we want to hear from you!


Key job responsibilities
Business Growth
• Set goals for your team aligned with organizational objectives
• Develop business strategies and identify input metrics that drive growth and improve customer and seller experiences, collaborating with cross-functional teams and Amazon programs
• Manage and deliver against complex goals where strategy is undefined, making tradeoffs between short-term seller needs and long-term strategic investments
• Implement and track metrics to measure team success and seller quality, using insights to guide work and uncover hidden opportunities

Relationship Management
• Build and cultivate strong relationships with sellers in your team's portfolio and internal stakeholders; serve as a trusted advisor and business advocate
• Monitor seller satisfaction survey results to investigate positive and negative feedback trends, establishing improvement plans and managing Account Manager expectations

Process Excellence
• Leverage customer feedback, market trends, and key metrics to contribute to strategic development of features and programs that accelerate seller growth and improve their Amazon experience
• Identify areas of unnecessary process or inefficiencies and work to simplify
• Optimize and scale improvements benefiting large customer sets through tools, processes, and simplified SOPs across multiple organizations, developing accountability mechanisms

Leadership
• Manage a team of KAM Leads & Account Managers (6-8 total team members)
• Act as a thought leader defining success criteria and understanding seller business needs in a dynamic environment, contributing to organizational strategic plans and documents
• Partner with external teams including Category Management, Fulfillment, Finance, Product, and Advertising to align programs and initiatives driving growth
• Manage recruiting and hiring efforts across your direct team and broader organization; coach, mentor, and develop your team

We are seeking an experienced Sales Operations Associate to join India Global Selling (INGS). INGS empowers individuals and businesses to expand their reach to customers worldwide. Since inception, Amazon India has enabled over $20B in global exports, helping businesses, exporters, D2C brands, and entrepreneurs scale their products to international markets.

Key job responsibilities
Sales Operations & Process Management
• Execute funnel processes for the sales team to support business operations, empowering the team to execute core selling activities and increase productivity
• Develop analytics and implement dashboards to increase sales productivity conversion rates, and sales velocity from different Sales funnel cohorts.
• Manage end-to-end lead operations process, from lead generation to qualification to distribution and tracking conversion across sales teams.

Systems & Tools Management
• Develop and maintain CRM systems, sales automation tools, and data warehouse integrations
• Build scalable data pipelines connecting multiple systems (ERP, CRM, BI tools) using Excel as a central analysis hub
• Create data validation frameworks and quality control processes to ensure accuracy across sales systems

A day in the life
This role will play a critical part in scaling and expanding our sales operations. You'll start your day by analyzing Sales funnel data using advanced Excel models, identifying trends and anomalies. You'll build automated reports that synthesize data from multiple sources. Throughout the day, you'll collaborate with sales teams to understand their challenges and build Excel-based tools that solve real problems. An ideal candidate is analytical, autonomous, and drives cross-functional collaboration with effective communication skills.

You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. Amazon has multiple WBLP trainee openings between April 2026 to June 2026 Trainees will participate in our 12-month work and training program in our San Francisco facilities.

All physical requirements are expected with reasonable accommodations:

* Regularly lift and/or move up to 40 pounds; and participate in group lifts for 41+ pounds

* Ability to work in an environment that operates 24/7 with an ability to participate in primary responder rotation and provide after-hours support as needed

* Working in cramped and/or elevated and/or noisy environments

* Bending, lifting, stretching, reaching, standing and walking for up to 8+ hours a day

* Ascending and descending ladders, stairs, and gangways safely and without limitation

* Tolerance for working in non-climate –controlled environment with temperature functions.

NOTE: Amazon is not able to provide sponsorship now or in the future for these positions. Eligible candidates must have work authorization without employer intervention to be considered.

NOTE: If applying for positions in Oregon (OR) and Ohio (OH), these sites are within AWS GovCloud region. Effective May 15, 2017, logical access to the AWS GovCloud region will be restricted to Amazon employees who are U.S. Citizens (GovCloud may NOT be accessed from outside of the United States). (Internal Only Section)

NOTE: A lump sum stipend will be provided to eligible candidates who need to relocate for this position.

Key job responsibilities
Vendor and team communication including data entry, coordinating with suppliers, and resolving inquiries from cross-functional teams

* Ensure that all billing associated with the Inventory supply chain is accurate, validated and ready for processing

* Assembling, addressing, stamping and arranging for the shipment of merchandise and materials

* Assist in daily scheduling of deliveries and pick-ups to and from production locations

* Keep precise records of all commodities going in and out of company is required

* Traveling with personal vehicle within the regional work area is required.

* Successfully completing the 12-month Work Based Learning Program training curriculum, including all required safety certifications, technical competencies, and performance mile

A day in the life
The Logistics Specialist reviews Data Center inventory, in-bound shipments, and ongoing demand to ensure that proper stock levels are maintained in the assigned data center to support build and repair activities. Working with the Logistics Manager, you will create plans to optimize the flow of parts through their lifecycle; tracking inventory location, movement, age, and returns. You will work closely with Data Center Operations Technicians and Data Center Engineers to fulfill parts quickly and accurately. You will also work with Procurement and Hardware Engineering to purchase new parts and interface directly with vendors to process RMAs and receive replacements. Regular and ongoing communications with vendors to resolve issues and help them understand our business requirements necessitates a high-level communicator.

In addition, Logistics Specialists are required to understand all aspects of production, adhere to strict safety standards, maintain very high quality, and be willing and able to work on powered equipment (i.e forklift or cherry picker). Candidates will work in a warehouse or data center environment depending on the region.

All candidates should be willing to work both independently and with a team. Work prioritization, organization skills, effective communication, and the ability to react quickly are critical to being successful.

You will be required to work shift work that will include days/nights and may be required to work weekends/holidays. Traveling within the regional work area is required. jobs.description:
At Amazon we believe that Every Day is still Day One! We’re working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright and driven people.

We are looking for a Technical Program Manager with expertise in electrical system design, reliability, and maintenance. The ideal candidate will be a highly motivated individual with a proven track record in electrical reliability space while improving electrical system maintenance programs & policies, proficient in creating road-maps for the standardization of maintenance programs, ability to interpret maintenance standards to ensure compliance, familiarity with CMMS (Computerized Maintenance Management Systems) and has the ability to perform in-depth analysis of trends in s

Key job responsibilities
- Use electrical reliability & maintenance expertise to perform maintenance plan gap assessments to industry standards
- Provide subject matter expertise in electrical distribution for - electrical maintenance outages and deficiency correction plans
- Support annual budgeting cycles and planning
- Develop and improve maintenance programs and policies for electrical systems at warehouse locations, including audits of existing programs in compliance with local codes and global standards
- Partner with Risk Management and other key stakeholders in changes to the electrical system maintenance programs, aligning with insurance requirements as applicable, including system inspections and testing
- Perform detailed calculations to establish standards and specifications
- Inspect installations and observe operations to ensure compliance with design and equipment specifications and safety standards.
- Work with CMMS team to improve electrical maintenance plans and ensure reliability data is available
- Support operations, construction, and other relevant departments with maintenance plans for new equipment and total cost ownership
- Audit electrical system maintenance practices to identify deviations and corrective actions.
- Monitor trends in electrical system maintenance reports, and escalate as necessary to drive improvements to maintenance activities, or immediate corrective actions to electrical systems.
- Support training and start-up of electrical system maintenance and impairment programs at new operations locations.
- Develop and improve installation, commissioning, and inspection processes, including audit practices, related to electrical systems.
- On Call support 4-5 times per year providing 24x7 support to network emergency electrical needs.s

A day in the life

About the team
As a member of the electrical maintenance and reliability team for Amazon's North American network, you will focus on ensuring optimal performance of electrical systems across facilities. The role includes analyzing maintenance procedures, implementing reliability improvements, and evaluating new initiatives for maintenance requirements and total cost of ownership considerations.

Electrical Engineering is an Operations and Maintenance focused team that has one mission - to support Operations with industry leading service in the fields of electrical reliability, safety, and resilience.

jobs.description:
Amazon's Global Operations Services & Support (GOSS) Compliance & Data Integrity (CDI) vertical is seeking a highly talented and motivated Risk Manager III to own complex risk quantification and business continuity programs within the Global Risk & Business Continuity function—a critical team that quantifies and contextualizes operational risk to influence strategic decisions across the $50B+ infrastructure portfolio, translating disruptions, vulnerabilities, and resilience gaps into financial and operational impact scenarios.
A successful candidate for this role will have an established background in risk management, strong analytical acumen with risk modeling and scenario planning, experience leveraging quantitative methods for risk assessment, along with excellent project management and communication skills. The candidate must demonstrate the ability to operate independently with limited guidance in ambiguous problem spaces, building consensus across Director-level organizations while creating predictable risk assessment frameworks and process paths.
The candidate will also have a proven track record of managing and mentoring team members, with a strong focus on operational excellence, process improvement, and measurable customer satisfaction.


Key job responsibilities
• Own and deliver complex risk quantification programs that span multiple teams or focus on critical risk areas (e.g., implementing integrated risk assessment models across regions, building scenario planning frameworks for operational disruptions, establishing business continuity protocols for critical facilities)
• Manage the full lifecycle of initiatives from idea through design, approval, build, launch, iteration, and deprecation
• Negotiate and define obligations with stakeholders, setting clear program objectives and success metrics
• Unblock teams and increase speed of delivery by identifying and resolving analytical, organizational, or resource constraints
• Identify opportunities where risk modeling could unlock business value or inform strategic investment decisions
• Partner with internal/external legal teams, policy owners, and regulators to fully understand and interpret risk drivers, regulatory requirements, and business constraints relevant to operational risk management
• Oversee development of risk quantification models and scenario planning frameworks, including testing and measuring effectiveness of risk assessment methodologies
• Provide long-term perspective and context for risk-related business and technology decisions involving operational resilience
• Influence roadmaps, business and technology decisions across CDI functions and partner organizations
• Contribute to risk-related policies and contracts that govern risk management implementation
• Write clear and compelling narratives (6-pagers, PR/FAQs) that explain risk quantification programs and their business impact
• Present effectively to Directors and VPs on risk assessments, scenario analyses, and strategic recommendations
• Drive efficiencies in how risk assessments are conducted and maintained
• Create predictable risk assessment frameworks that teams can follow independently
